Author: CommandingTiger
Comment: This game and Final Fantasy 16 have to be games of the year, although I can change my mind on FF16 later but I doubt I‚Äôll be disapointed. This is how you make an RE game. This is how all RE games should be made. Turning is still not quick enough imo, maybe I should change my settings. The next remake should be either Code Veronica or even RE Outbreak as a multiplayer co-op survival game to get out safely from infested cities like Racoon city, and multiple parts (maps) scenarios from it. Finding randomly placed ammo and weapons (granted a section should have more of the same ammo types as said found weapon but also other ammo type) and everyone starts with a basic handgun. Add to that a single player campaign, perhaps even a proper prequel to Jill Valentine‚Äôs story as we all know RE3 remake was quite literally cut in half or an in-between section that was never fully realized. The part I loved the most of the original RE3 was walking in downtown collecting loot, ammo and killing zombies.I also loved the upper town where you needed to go to different locations and on your choosing, you‚Äôd have Nemesis appear 1/2 times out of the 6 locations making a lot of replay-ability with choices to either run of fight. It can be a prequel to RE3 remake where she was in a closed safe sector of the city as the infestation was closed off where they though most the infestation was under control and needed sleep.  She also gets bitten so that brings the lucid dream of being infected. It would end would zombie bursting out of an alley fence and Jill escaping to the police controlled safe zone of the city. Nemesis is not yet present. As the original game, he only shows himself later, not in the downtown area before it gets overrun in RE3 remake.You have to imagine that this post apocalyptic zombie scenario did not just happen on day 1 for Raccoon City.  Why would Jill sleep despite obvious mayhem outside?  Because everyone needs sleep and she was ‚Äúchanging shift‚Äù  but one of the officers on duty Brad saw Nemesis breaking the defenses and making his way to Jill‚Äôs apartment.  It‚Äôs also Nemesis who broke the trough the barriers and compromised the downtown area. You could also make it that Nemesis burst from a wall in the restaurant and kills Brad as a nod to the original rather than thinking just a regular zombie killed him. Anyway, it would have it‚Äôs own scenarios, and over time you‚Äôd add more scenarios and outcome in the Outbreak game.You would upgrade your weapons over time.You could also have hoard modes where you kill as many zombies as possible. I feel like Capcom is maybe trying too hard with all these multiplayer games. It would probably be best to have 1 game to rule them all in that regard.Meaning, bring the other Mercenary modes within this Outbreak game as a universal hub for All Resident Evil Multi-player games still active.It‚Äôs pointless to divide the fan base across so many different titles.Outbreak should also contain Multiplayer Co-Op Mercenary Mode as well from RE4 and RE8, for those interested. Outbreak should contain many types of game play mode from Re:Verses to Co-Op Mercenary, to Escape infected cities scenarios on co-op. That‚Äôs just my opinion. Leave it as feedback. It would be a nice surprise just to have Outbreak as a remake. It does sound a lot like an RE5 remake in the works.If that‚Äôs the case, on top of bringing combat elements from RE4R and RE5, do you think it would be possible to upgrade your character to make new moves?From Round house kicks, to punches, to uppercut, to rushing in with a shoulder bash to frontal trusting with combat knife like Dante in DMC.  This also means you can affect stats that increases strength (damage from physical), speed, precision, endurance and health to increase your chances of survival.In RE4R, it wasn‚Äôt made very clear that mixing certain herbs increased Max Health. Maybe have a much bigger blade and have it be only 1 button press instead with the direction of the analog determining what move will be associated, such as front would be trust, back + hold button would be block, left of right would be left or right horizontal swing slash.  The knife combat is still pretty good in RE4, I changed my settings to 1 button press only and it makes more sense, I like the parry and counter mechanics and it needs to be implemented in the next RE5.  Of course, who can forget everyone‚Äôs favorite ability.  The boulder bashing!  Chirst is built to be a power lifter so maybe lifting heavy objects and throwing them could deal heavy damage.Throwing knifes also comes to mind for Sheva to prevent lost of bullets. That‚Äôs where accuracy and precision points comes into play. Just like strength only affects melee.

Author: nmendez79
Comment: Hello, This is a repost of a comment I made on an earlier blogpost for this game (with some edits). I just finished the base game on ‚Äúhard,‚Äù and I feel compelled to express my thoughts here, given the lack of meaningful options for players to provide any feedback. Playing HFW was one of the worst gaming experiences I‚Äôve ever had on Playstation (for context, I invite you to see my trophy list to see the games I typically play; I also play avidly on Nintendo and Microsoft platforms). The combat and some other core gameplay mechanics felt so awful at times that it completely decimated my overall experience with the game. The amount of stagger and knockdown in this game is astounding, and especially frustrating during timed events. At times I just put the controller down so that I could wait for Aloy to get back up. All of the ancillary events (hunting grounds, melee pits, arena, and races) were tuned horribly in terms of difficulty. Granted, I played the game on ‚Äúhard,‚Äù but ‚Äúhard‚Äù during these events felt much harder than the story missions and the game world overall. The bow used to tether enemies to the ground simply did not work. Melee combat was absolutely horrible (I had to ‚Äúcheese‚Äù one of the bosses because I kept getting killed, sometimes in just two hits). The melee combat tutorials were just terrible. Your in-game explanations for these mechanics were at times entirely inaccurate.  These are just some of the many complaints I have of this game. Despite these problems, I plowed through the game to get the platinum trophy. I am getting the DLC because I had already planned on doing that (indeed, that‚Äôs why I waited until now to play the base game). Having said that, if the combat isn‚Äôt tuned better, this will be the last Horizon game I‚Äôll ever play (at the very least this will be the last Horizon game I intend on purchasing at full price on day one). Please consider fixing these issues going forward. Thank you for your time. nmendez79

Author: CommandingTiger
Comment: Hey PS.  What are you thinking about this new ‚ÄúQ Lite‚Äù handheld system?  If it‚Äôs just going to be a remote play device, just put out remote play on more Android devices and the Vita and call it a day.  Either way, you need to port Remote play on PS5, the PS Vita can remote play the PS4 and there‚Äôs no reason to do the same with the PS5.If it‚Äôs remote play only, then it‚Äôs DOA.  It needs full PS4 and PS5 compatibility/emulation but at a lower performance. I don‚Äôt think you heard me correctly.  That system only made sense as a ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù controller with Remote Play ability with s bigger battery.That controller would add additional features and functions inside each PS5 exclusive games like inventory management, additional buttons actions, scope shooting zoom in vision for shooters, puzzle solving, RTS ‚ÄúStrategy games‚Äù selecting troops, etc.  It would be better than just a touch pad  It would require software and hardware to save on battery greatly, keep the screen off most of the time for a better battery efficiency  and a much bigger battery. This system only makes sense in a hybrid Handheld/Home console system.  Where instead of ‚Äúremoving the joycons‚Äù, it keeps all of it‚Äôs component, but removes the main system console chip, while keeping the little sister system for smaller tasks and functions. The main system would also have it‚Äôs own dock that would connect to the TV as well as connection itself to additional SSD memory and Blu Ray drive. You can make a Ryzen console with 16Gb of Ram similar to a mobile device like the Asus ROG Ally handheld with more power than the Steam Deck that would rival and surpass the Xbox Series S (since it has more Ram) meaning it would make it easy for third party games to port the game over that if it‚Äôs on Xbox Series S, then it has to release on this handheld system. With Ryzen architecture, it makes it significantly easier to port the games over to the handheld. You would just scale down on this handheld for 1080p, 30fps to 60fps. If you can run Horizon Zero Dawn on the Steam Deck, you can run Forbidden West on a stronger Handheld.It‚Äôs not like with the Vita using an outdated ARM mobile chip with low Ram like the PS3. The architecture is significantly too different and under-powered. This ‚ÄúQ Lite‚Äù would have a dock behind the console to sit the main console board. You‚Äôre still releasing PS4 games and handhelds are now much stronger than a PS4 now.   It would also feature Blue-tooth to connect to a PS5 or the handheld in dock mode. If you are just releasing this system as a remote play only controller, then there is 0 appeal and would be a waste of money for everyone, don‚Äôt waste your money.People can already remote play on their phone and that‚Äôs fine enough.The way it‚Äôs being described, I‚Äôd have to says that it is DOA and won‚Äôt sell well.  You need the whole package.You need to be able to play your PS5 games on the go (and PS4) while lower specs obviously.  It still needs 16Gb of Ram to avoid any memory issues like TLOU P! on  PC.Easy to port, mass appeal in Japan. People want a real handheld and it won‚Äôt affect the PS5‚Äôs graphics at all, just the resolution and fps. It won‚Äôt be having dedicated studios making handheld only games, but rather a handheld that emulates all PS4 and runs PS5 games. There‚Äôs way too many handheld consoles to miss out on the growing market. Also use SD, USB memory, M.2 SSD or traditional type of memory.  NO SONY OWNED MEMORY CARDS! They‚Äôre too expensive and don‚Äôt protect games.Blu-Ray games will need to be scanned once every 4 months or accessed via your PS5 from home to confirm you own that game for disc games.Your efforts to port games on this handheld will be significantly easier than those to port PS5 games to the wide array of PCs running on Windows with DX12.Be smart and it‚Äôll be a success.

Author: CommandingTiger
Comment: The ‚ÄúQ Lite‚Äù must have an OLED with Sony back HDR color calibration options for the screen.It needs replaceable battery similar to the PSP for longevity. By all means, don‚Äôt just send this as a controller with a screen, have it be a hybrid device console that plays PS4/PS5 games and run PS4 games as a PS4 pro mode. If the Q Lite also has an ARM chip, for whatever reason, then it should play PSP/Vita games too.  If that‚Äôs the case. Remote play don‚Äôt always connect as most jobs and public areas legit block access to do so. So it would be absolutely pointless to release this without making it a console as well.

Comment: This is the price of a big step up. Ratchet and Clank PS5ReturnalHorizone burning shores It would be rough if ps5‚Äôs were still a scalper festival, but Sony has it available and at a cut price no less with Ragnarok digital. The good news is a 10 year old console the ps4 is worth something on resale, sell it or trade it at gamestop towards a ps5. I wouldn‚Äôt even want to go back to the pro and that was a big step up over base. If this was multi gen it would take away from the scope of the game if they used the ssd and other features accordingly. Some games switch to 5 to pc rig are just low to high settings but the truly transformative stuff requires a baseline. It‚Äôs why switch us living that ps3 life, with their ‚Äúhd rumble‚Äù on life support leaning all their basket on $60 3ds 2.0 games. Point is if you want more complexity you need the hardware iterations. 2011-2012 off the rack components for ps4 in 2023 don‚Äôt cut the mustard on 4k tvs. Nintendo knows that why they play the art style game mechanic music game, they have boxed themselves in their best games are better than their rivals despite their self imposed limitations not because of it. I want all ps5 tentpoles to be ps5 exclusive Spiderman 2 next needs to be that and will be, and will drive adoption more than any sony game thus far. But i appreciate you‚Äôd like to play this on what you have i get that, it will be on pc also. Worst case play the great stuff on your console while you save / decide on 5 etc. Devs want to make it cool, and 10 year old hardware is not that. Pandemic dragged a few more years onto 4.

Comment: Rooting for Stig to come through like he did on GoW3. My son is excited about Zelda the most but this is up there having watched both new trailers this weekend. Might wait till the summer though so we can both play it. We played some of FO yesterday and it was very smooth and clean on 5 so it will be nice to see how it will have evolved and iteration on gameplay, new story, set pieces, platforming bosses etc. I am hoping this one has a better platinum, got that on jedi master was more fun bumping combat difficulty up if you are a veteran of these games, same as ragnarok, spiderman etc. If there are cosmetics in boxes and stems and nothing else it will be a huge fail, this was one of the largest short comings of the first game, and unlike the technical issues was never able to receive a remedy. I also hope they drop the cheesy push x to name of developer every death aka respawn, and the biggest thing personally is the straight up inferior copy / cribbing off dark souls bon fires. Make an original game here it doesn‚Äôt make the game better riffing from, and i say that as a from player. Dark souls does not equal Star Wars. I know why it was crow barred in and if this new one has these same gripes ill wait for a 50% off sale or whatever it will be in black friday week. EA discounts their games quickly. 90% off fallen order for example these days. I‚Äôd like this to do really well even with the shadow of TotK, but 1 was a 7.5-8 for me but a fun game to play overall, and the best star wars ip since pre Disney or maybe awakens if you love abrams and wholsale copying episode 4. I wouldn‚Äôt mind a cal movie at this point, he‚Äôs a great actor too available. But enjoy the game either way whoever is day one or otherwise. Author: nmendez79
Comment: Hello, I just finished the base game on ‚Äúhard,‚Äù and I  feel compelled to express my thoughts here, given the lack of meaningful options for players to provide any feedback. Playing HFW was one of the worst gaming experiences I‚Äôve ever had on Playstation (for context, I invite you to see my trophy list; I also play avidly on Nintendo and Microsoft platforms). The combat and some of the other core gameplay mechanics felt so awful at times that it completely decimated my overall experience with the game. The amount of stagger and knockdown in this game is astounding, and especially frustrating during timed events. At times I just put the controller down so that I could wait for Aloy to get back up. All of the ancillary events (hunting grounds, melee pits, arena, and races) were tuned horribly in terms of difficulty. Granted, I finished the game on ‚Äúhard,‚Äù  but ‚Äúhard‚Äù during these events felt much harder than the story missions and the game world overall. The bow used to tether enemies simply did not work. Melee combat was absolutely horrible (I had to ‚Äúcheese‚Äù one of the bosses because I kept getting killed, sometimes in just two hits). These are just some of the many complains I have of this game. Despite these problems, I plowed through the game to get the platinum trophy. I am getting the DLC because I had already planned on doing that (indeed, that‚Äôs why I waited until now to play the base game). Having said that, if the combat isn‚Äôt tuned better, this will be the last Horizon game I‚Äôll ever play (at the very least the Horizon game I intend on purchasing at full price on day one). Please consider fixing these issues. Thank you for your time. nmendez79

Author: turniplord
Comment: I wish there was an easy way for us to supply feedback and suggestions so that PlayStation knows what features we want and what things aren‚Äôt working. They can look at trends and how the system is being used, but if there‚Äôs something missing then they‚Äôll never understand this by looking at how existing features are being used. For example ‚Äì simply allowing us to press ‚ÄòOptions‚Äô on an installed game in the Game Library SHOULD give us the complete set of options to perform things such as looking for an update, accessing save data, or pinning them to the home screen. Instead, you have to literally load a game (even if you‚Äôre playing something else) so it appears on the home screen, then back out to the home screen again ‚Äì now we have the options. We shouldn‚Äôt have to do this. Another required feature is the ability to invert the controller sticks via the system menu ‚Äì either under accessibility or the DualSense Edge customisation. I don‚Äôt mean the option we have now, an option to FORCE it to invert in games that don‚Äôt support it. Xbox does this, as do a few PS4 3rd party controllers, but nothing on the PS5. Then we get to things like the ‚ÄòAdd on‚Äô tile being removed from the PSN store ‚Äì this was literally the only way to access all the new DLC items that had been released in a sortable list. It was perfect. But, it was originally an ‚Äòadvert‚Äô, so you had to be lucky that it appeared as the ads rotated, now you‚Äôve removed it from ever appearing ‚Äì this NEEDS to come back as a sticky tile in the store, publishers and developers are losing out on millions in purchases and consumers have no idea new content is out for games they own. There are a lot of features and tweaks we‚Äôd love to see, but there‚Äôs nowhere to voice these to PlayStation ‚Äì maybe you could have a forum for consumers, or even lock it out to level-4 people if you only want a few people recommending things (I‚Äôve been Level-4 for many months now).

Author: mrc247
Comment: My feedback on the new update is unfortunately negative. To say something positive, the wireless update of the controller worked perfectly, very nice!(But it‚Äôs about time that Sony offered the feature, Microsoft and even Nintendo have been offering the feature for years) What I don‚Äôt like at all is the new game hub: 1.) The trophy field is no longer visible at first glance, you have to scroll down first, this is not an improvement, on the contrary. 2.) The playing time of the games is still not counted correctly. e.g. I have already played God of War Ragnar√∂k for over 60 hours, but in my profile and now also in the game hub it says 34 hours. The fact that it is now so present in the game hub only makes me even more annoyed that Sony has not implemented this feature correctly. 3.) The Game Hub now also shows the progress in a game based on the progress of the main missions. In a game I‚Äôve just played through, however, only 86% is displayed. My guess is that it‚Äôs because I haven‚Äôt played the DLC. But I think a DLC should not be taken into account. 4.) I was happy that the PS4 feature that lets you see which friends have played a game has come back. But unfortunately the feature doesn‚Äôt seem to work properly on the PS5 with the update either. When playing God of War Ragnar√∂k, the Game Hub tells me that NONE of my friends have played the game. If I then click on the tile, however, it is shown to me that 17 people have it. Otherwise, it‚Äôs nice that you can finally sort the playlists, but why can‚Äôt I do it manually according to my own needs, but only according to the options provided by Sony??? Microsoft and Nintendo are doing a better job there too. Conclusion: With the wireless controller update, a long-awaited feature is finally coming to the PS5, but the new Game Hub is not a real improvement and unfortunately also has many bugs. Too bad Sony, another missed opportunity.

Author: mrc247
Comment: PS5 system software improvement suggestions New features: ‚Äì Decrease disc drive volume/speed when starting console and starting a game (like on Xbox One/Series)‚Äì Automatic updates from all games installed, not just the last 10 played/installed (available on Xbox One/Series, Wii U, Switch)‚Äì Create a possibility to manually check all installed games (incl. external drives) for updates at once (available on Xbox One/Series)‚Äì add an icon directly to the trophies, the settings and the storage management in the control center‚Äì Add a menu item to end a game in the Control Center‚Äì Show controller battery status in % and not just in 3 bars‚Äì Remove the limit of 100 items on the PS Store Wishlist‚Äì Remove the PS+ cloud storage limit of 1,000 files, so 100 GB of storage space makes no sense‚Äì Bluetooth support for headphones / headsets‚Äì Create the possibility to use the microphone of the controller, but still output the voice chat via the TV‚Äì Implement Low Framerate Compensation (LFC) feature to make Variable Refresh Rate (VRR) work below 48Hz (available on Xbox Series)‚Äì Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos for gaming (available on Xbox Series)‚Äì A feature compared to Microsoft‚Äôs ‚ÄúFPS Boost‚Äù (available on Xbox Series) Bringing back old features: ‚Äì Create a possibility to sort installed games according to your own needs, e.g. with folders or groups (available on PS3, PS4, Xbox One/Series, 3DS, Wii U, Switch) => the ‚Äúgame lists‚Äù unfortunately do not work for installed games, only for the library. In addition, the ‚Äúgame lists‚Äù lack important functions such as the possibility of manually sorting the games within a list.‚Äì In the options/context menu for the installed games in the library show the same options as on the home screen e.g. the option ‚Äúcheck for updates‚Äù and ‚ÄúPS+ cloud saves‚Äù (available on PS4)‚Äì Bring back friends‚Äô activity feed (available on PS4, Xbox One/Series, Switch)‚Äì Change log (update history) for PS5 games (like PS4 games)‚Äì Themes/themes/wallpapers for home screen (available on PS4)‚Äì An option to set the number of games on the home screen to unlimited (available on PS4)‚Äì A search function in the game library on PS5 (available on PS4), on the web PS Store (library.playstation.com) and in the PS App fix bugs: ‚Äì Fix the bug that often the playing time in the profile is not counted‚Äì Fix the bug that the PS4 label is not displayed in the profile on the PS5 for PS4 games‚Äì Fixed the bug where soundtracks, artbooks etc are not shown as such in profile on PS5 as opposed to when viewing profile on PS4‚Äì Fix the bug that the profile on PS4 and PS5 shows a different number of games‚Äì Fix PS5 Games Saves PS+ Sync error‚Äì Implement an M.2 SSD benchmark that displays correct values and can still be run after formatting Trophies: ‚Äì Bring back the trophy ‚Äúping‚Äù sound‚Äì Save sorting of trophy lists (available on PS4)‚Äì Make the trophy tracker transparent and as an overlay element so that the screen is not clipped when tracking (available on Xbox One/Series)‚Äì Track trophy progress for each trophy, not just a few (available on Xbox One/Series)‚Äì When getting a trophy, not only the name should be displayed, but also the unlock condition (available on Xbox One/Series)‚Äì Remove the trophy level cap from 999, the world‚Äôs top trophy hunters would already be at level 2300+‚Äì Jump to the current game when opening the trophy lists in the list (available on PS4)

Author: MdMaynard
Comment: Thank you Sony team for all your incredible hard work on the  evolution of the beautiful PS5 system. I am so happy and impressed with the direction it has taken and the future I see on the horizon.There is only one feature that I truly miss that I did & would still be using on a daily basis. The ability to check & respond to my PSN messages via my PC. While I game on my 78in OLED, I have an additional 24in screen to my left I keep my PC open on. It is too much an interruption to message on the PS5 as I need to pause jump completely out of game for that moment. The phone app is the only other option though because of it‚Äôs size I need to turn my attention completely to the phone to read & respond to my PSN messages.When I was able to use the PC I could glance at the 24in screen & easily see what was written without barely an interruption in my gaming & without looking away. Same with responding as I would use the desktop keyboard & could easily type quickly with one hand, (or extremely fast with two hands), either way it never noticeably interrupted my gaming. Responding via the phone app (for me anyway), requires me to put down the Dualsense & use both hands as well as full focus to read the small screen.It‚Äôs the only PSN feature that was on the PC that had significant value to me. I would really love to again see the ability to access PSN messsages via the PC. Though if it never returns I will still remain an extremely loyal & happy PS5, & future PS** gamer!! Thank you Sony team.

Author: stage300handsome
Comment: I see a lot always say we gamer‚Äôs that have grew up with PlayStation since its start have changed, I don‚Äôt agree with that at all. I think studios are the change, they are full of people who are creative, but like Hollywood have run out of ideals for the most part and as a company they are no longer concerned with your feedback on anything, they assume they have your business, and they pander to other crowds that aren‚Äôt really loyal to the brand or experience. Square Enix a great studio, and I‚Äôm looking forward to a lot of their titles, but I think they lost their magic of always coming up with titles that interest the base now because they try to do to much to please western audiences, when in truth the ones that will buy a title preorder or day one are not looking for western styles.And that brings me to the point now with this State of Play that I finally got around to watching because most of them the past yr haven‚Äôt been good or having something your wanting to see, even though Baldur‚Äôs and a few of the other single player rpgs and action adventures looked good , so much pushing the sucide squad and online ones along with the woke stuff, really kind of brought it done. But that is the best thing out what Sony is that during the Ps1 and 2 its was full of any genre you wanted. There‚Äôs still just as much variety as then but they all lean toward the same thing wanting online and free for all.I have two sons who like to game and for the past few yrs its been Fortnite and CoD nonstop back and forth all day that they can, and I have every system from the late 80‚Äôs up to now. And they have sat and played around with them in the past or sat and watched me, it was usually that looks boring or it cheats so bad, looks rough. But now that they have gotten older, I will see them try some different games here and there, and was really shocked to learn they got Legend of Dragoon and Wild Arms and been playing them the past few weeks. But apparently, they didn‚Äôt realize I had the originals. I found out by taking them out to Game Stop and a few local used gaming stores, they were looking where I was looking and I said guys used passed by the C‚Äôs already, then I heard my youngest ask a worker if they  had chrono trigger for Ps4 or 5 and I was like I got that at home if you want to play it, but its not on the newest consoles. They then came up asking questions about others, so they must have been researching or seen others watching their youtube videos on the games they play, I still don‚Äôt get that, but was kind of glad  they were trying some of my favorites now. And for the last month I haven‚Äôt heard shooting or all the Fortnite crazy sounds coming from their room. But Hey, maybe we will find out what Bluepoint has going on soon, or Insomniac‚Äôs known games like Spiderman or Wolverine since those guys at least get how to make superhero games, or maybe Ronin or one of the FF games coming up. I figure State of Decay will continue on like the monthly games on Plus, a once in a while shock you month.

Author: Kadeemluvmusic
Comment: What‚Äôs with the hype, Sony? This doesn‚Äôt feels like a State Of Play showcase. The only good parts of the showcase were brand new gameplay footage of Resident Evil 4 and adding its Mercenaries level, which looks awesome. Street Fighter 6 gameplay looks unique adding three more characters, and a Naruto Ultimate Storm game, could be a remastered version of past Ultimate Ninja Storm games from the PS2/3 years. If it‚Äôs getting remastered, sign me up and take my money. As for the rest, well‚Ä¶about the new trailer for the game, Suicide Squad Kills The Justice League. We were all skeptical (and excited) for the game, Kevin Conroy‚Äôs final performance as Batman will be emotional and heartbreaking saying goodbye to one of the most beloved actor portraying The Dark Knight for 30 years. Author: nathincrow84
Comment: I‚Äôm waiting for the PC steam release! I pre-ordered Horizon Zero Dawn back when it released and started playing it on PS4. I was playing a lot of games. I‚Äôve got a PS4 Pro, Xbox One X, and a Switch. I also had a decent pc to play games on and recently built a better gaming PC. Back to the point. I temporarily got out of games shortly after the release of Zero Dawn, due to non-stop work, and wasn‚Äôt able to get back into games for around a year. Then I started playing games on all my consoles, then slowly started playing more on PC. I noticed that Horizon Zero Dawn was on steam and was like ‚Äúmine‚Äù. I‚Äôve been playing solely on PC for a little over 2 years now. I haven‚Äôt touched my Xbox, PlayStation or Switch in roughly the same amount of time. I still do updates to them now and again. I did buy Forbidden West on my PlayStation and played for several hours and then stopped. Because it‚Äôs hard for me to get back into console play. PC‚Äôs just play games better than consoles, and games also look better. I‚Äôm hoping Sony ramps up their game catalog for PC and soon. I thought about getting the PS5 and Series X consoles, but then I was like nah, I‚Äôll just build a gaming PC. There‚Äôs still quite a few games from both consoles that I‚Äôve got to get for pc. Which most are from Xbox. Sony doesn‚Äôt have a lot of their exclusive titles ported yet. I‚Äôm hoping they ramp up porting their titles and start getting them to steam soon, and don‚Äôt make everyone wait 2-3 years after game launch to port to steam. Sorry I know I‚Äôve been rambling on. I‚Äôm done now. Just want to start play Forbidden West on PC. Peace

In addition, the ‚Äúgame lists‚Äù lack important functions such as the possibility of sorting the games within a list.‚Äì In the options/context menu for the installed games in the library show the same options as on the home screen e.g. the option ‚Äúcheck for updates‚Äù and ‚ÄúPS+ cloud saves‚Äù (available on PS4)‚Äì Bring back friends‚Äô activity feed (available on PS4, Xbox One/Series, Switch)‚Äì Change log (update history) for PS5 games (like PS4 games)‚Äì Themes/themes/wallpapers for home screen (available on PS4)‚Äì An option to set the number of games on the home screen to unlimited (available on PS4)‚Äì A search function in the game library on PS5 (available on PS4), on the web PS Store (library.playstation.com) and in the PS App fix bugs: ‚Äì Fix the bug that often the playing time in the profile is not counted‚Äì Fix the bug that the PS4 label is not displayed in the profile on the PS5 for PS4 games‚Äì Implement an M.2 SSD benchmark that displays correct values and can still be run after formatting‚Äì Fix the bug that soundtracks, artbooks etc. are not displayed as such in the profile on PS5, as opposed to when viewing the profile on a PS4‚Äì Fix the bug that the profile on PS4 and PS5 shows a different number of games‚Äì Fix PS5 Games Saves PS+ Sync error Trophies: ‚Äì Bring back the trophy ‚Äúping‚Äù sound‚Äì Save sorting of trophy lists (available on PS4)‚Äì Jump to the current game when opening the trophy lists in the list (available on PS4)‚Äì Make the trophy tracker transparent and as an overlay element so that the screen is not clipped when tracking (available on Xbox One/Series)‚Äì Track trophy progress for each trophy, not just a few (available on Xbox One/Series)‚Äì When getting a trophy, not only the name should be displayed, but also the unlock condition (available on Xbox One/Series)‚Äì Remove the trophy level cap from 999, the world‚Äôs top trophy hunters would already be at level 2300+

Author: Ruterga
Comment: Llevo m√°s de 30 horas, 2 en la demo de PC y m√°s de 29 horas en PS5.El juego es muy bueno. No merece todo el ‚Äúhate‚Äù que la gente est√° expresando.La historia est√° bien. Esa especie de ‚ÄúAlicia en el pa√≠s de las maravillas‚Äù moderno/extendido, est√° bien desarrollada.Las magias son abundantes, distintas y espectaculares visualmente.El mundo abierto tiene much√≠simas actividades secundarias, cofres y enemigos. El mapa es divertido de recorrer tanto en extensi√≥n como en verticalidad y paso mucho rato haciendo cosas por todos lados.Hay variedad de personajes con tramas y personalidades variadas. Y tiene m√°s variedad de enemigos de lo que pensaba en un inicio en la demo, que era algo que me manten√≠a expectante.Puedo entender que molesten los problemas de optimizaci√≥n en PC, pero eso no es todo. En general, est√° muy bien es m√≠nimo un 8/10. Y en PS5 funciona muy bien. Es m√°s, si nos ce√±imos a la versi√≥n de PS5, que para eso estamos en el blog de PlayStation, dir√≠a que es m√°s un 9/10. Yo lo estoy disfrutando mucho, tanto en los directos con la historia principal, como en mis ratos libres farmeando por el mundo. No pienso dejarlo sin platino.

Author: Ruterga
Comment: I‚Äôm over 30 hours in, 2 on the PC demo and over 29 hours on PS5.The game is very good. He doesn‚Äôt deserve all the ‚Äúhate‚Äù that people are expressing.The story is fine. That kind of modern/extended ‚ÄúAlice in Wonderland‚Äù is well developed.Magic powers are abundant, different and visually spectacular.The open world has tons of side activities, chests, and enemies. The map is fun to navigate. Both in length and verticality and I spend a lot of time doing things all over the place.There‚Äôre a variety of characters with varied plots and personalities. And it has more variety of enemies than I initially thought in the demo, which was something that kept me looking forward to it.I can understand being bothered by optimization issues on PC, but that‚Äôs not all. In general, it‚Äôs a very good game, it‚Äôs a minimum of 8/10. And on PS5 it works great. If we stick to the PS5 version, which is why we‚Äôre on the PlayStation blog, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs more a 9/10. I‚Äôm enjoying it a lot, streaming the main story, and in my spare time farming around the world. I‚Äôm not leaving it without platinum trophy.

Miles Morales, Spidey Remastered, Demon‚Äôs Souls, Returnal, R&C, Forbidden West, MLB, GT7, TLOU PT1, God of War Ragnarok, Spiderman 2, Factions, Call of the Mountain. 13 AAA first party games and 12 AAA first party exclusives in the first 3 years. Author: iamtylerdurden1
Comment: If you are claiming PlayStation VR2 is overpriced you are clueless. Just do some research, Sony‚Äôs hmd largely has better specs than valve index which is about $1,000. You can argue PS VR2 is a more impressive set and it‚Äôs half the price. Have you seen the controllers?  Valve index controllers are $300 alone and Sony‚Äôs have haptics and adaptive triggers, obviously finger tracking and such. The headset is 4K OLED with foviated rendering, eye tracking, and haptics. Psvr was a toy, PS VR2 is a premium set and honestly for 550 that‚Äôs a deal but people are too stupid to realize that. I know anything over 500 looks bad but you have to understand the tech you are getting. If anything you can argue the Dual sense edge is a much worse deal by comparison but even that is about the going rate when you consider it has haptics and adaptive triggers which the other premium controllers do not. But I can understand if people want to complain about that price however psvr2 appears to be well worth the price for the tech you are receiving particularly considering you only need a PS5 to run it at maximum capacity. I‚Äôm so tired of the idiocy surrounding the psvr2 price point. I think 550 is perfectly reasonable considering it comes with those controllers I don‚Äôt think people understand how much these controllers cost.

There are a few exceptions here and there ‚Äì the limited-time Windtrace event that just wrapped up (a ‚ÄúProp Hunt‚Äù clone) requires multiplayer, for example. But you can skip events like that with little loss (or, in my case, let one of my kids play on my account because she loves Windtrace). I understand some people love the type of game that requires multiplayer co-op or competition, and Genshin CAN be that type of game if you want it to be (within certain limits), but it doesn‚Äôt demand it, and you rarely miss out on a lot by skipping it. I love that.

Author: KazeEternal
Comment: One request I‚Äôd love to make of this controller which I hope is possible with a firmware update. Making the rear buttons R4 and L4. I love that I can assign things to them for double purpose. That‚Äôs honestly my primary purchase reason. I‚Äôd prefer that the standard controller remain that standard for the time being. Some cases it would be nice to just have two extra buttons on the controller. God of War Ragnarok ironically is one such case. I‚Äôd have loved to of assigned the rage button to an R4 or L4 button. L3 and R3 are way to overloaded on that game, too many times I‚Äôd dash in and lock on at the same time, only to be met with confusion and panic as my meter depleted before my eyes during a berserk fight or other difficult encounter. Dare I say as much as GoWR is my GotY it makes a ton of stupid input and UI related mistakes. Some of which are completely unforgivable. For instance there should have been more care taken in handling weapon switching mid recovery and mid combo. I‚Äôm the sort who treats the D-Pad like it‚Äôs Gears of War with each weapon asigned to a direction. It gets confusing when your fists are considered a weapon and suddenly after pressing a button again puts your weapon again instead insuring you‚Äôre ready to start using the blades the minute you‚Äôre done with a spear. Something encouraged by the game with one of its relics mind you in order to activate a magic circle around your character. Mapping the rear keys is immensly helpful. As someone who has already modded a standard DSG2 controller and DS4 with those buttons its a blessing. Particularly with Crisis Core where some of its minigames forget that the thumb is now busy with an analog stick instead of burdening your index finger with camera control while picking up materia. Switching to my other controller from my God of War controller, made this mini game a breeze like I rememberd it on PSP. Thankfully that was a situation a Dual Sense Edge can solve (happy to get one btw, yay preorders). Letting R4 and L4 be a thing to fix over burrdened buttons. Would be a blessing. I think they only thing I didn‚Äôt try was remapping rage to the touch pad as a swipe up. Probably would have been the better idea. Thank the SMS team for adding swipe and Sixaxis options, they made my experience a dream.

Author: AgentOttsel
Comment: For God of War Ragnarok, there‚Äôs actually an option to use Circle + X for activating Rage, which I find way better. That game has lots of great options, like swapping the Jump and Dodge buttons, gyro assisted aiming, Holding X (or Circle) next to an enemy instead of clicking the stick to activate brutal moves, etcetera. I definitely agree that we need actual separate inputs in the form of L4 and R4. I would even go for L5 and R5 like the Steam Deck, but unfortunately I think we missed that chance at the start of the generation, and now we can only hope that the PS6 controller will have those extra inputs by default, or that the DualSense Edge will support L4 and R5 on Steam (which they were able to do for the Xbox Elite controller‚Äôs 4 extra buttons).

Author: Issen_Mode
Comment: The dualsense edge sounds real in depth and intricate and impressive and all but uh, can‚Äôt you just make the regular ones have better analog stick modules? I had to send in the one that came with the console after 4 months of use due to stick drift. It feels like the black one I bought is starting to have the same issue too and it‚Äôs also after a few months. The left stick is creaking now. These controllers are really good otherwise, but they aren‚Äôt cheap. Never had this issue with dualshock 4 btw even after 5 years I still have the same red one‚Ä¶ All in all it‚Äôs a bit demoralizing to have to consider buying a deluxe $200 controller just in case one of the sticks wears out. Then having to buy another stick for $20 if that happens? Idk, I just feel like regular dualsense is nearly perfect already, just that one glaring issue holds it back severely. Within one year having to possibly replace or send in 2 different controllers has never happened to me for the 20ish years of playing video games. Maybe with sixaxis (before dualshock 3) back in the day, but none of the others lol.
